alert.note: Alert for Vermilion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:46PM CDT until August 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL VERMILION AND EAST CENTRAL CHAMPAIGN COUNTIES... At 745 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Potomac to St. Joseph, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Potomac, Fithian, Muncie, Rossville and Oakwood. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 187 and 211, and between mile markers 216 and 220. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing wind damage in northern Vermilion County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
